titles.title: Truth in Automobile Insurance Rates Act of 2005

To amend title I of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to require persons who are plan administrators of employee pension benefit plans or provide administrative services to such plans, and who also provide automobile insurance coverage or provide persons offering such coverage identifying information relating to plan participants or beneficiaries, to submit to the Federal Trade Commission certain information relating to such automobile insurance coverage.
Truth in Automobile Insurance Rates Act of 2005

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Employer-Employee Relations.

bill.summary: Truth in Automobile Insurance Rates Act of 2005 - Amends the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 (ERISA) to require that certain information relating to automobile insurance coverage be submitted to the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) by persons: (1) who are plan administrators of employee pension benefit plans or provide administrative services to such plans; and (2) who also provide automobile insurance coverage or provide persons offering such coverage identifying information relating to plan participants or beneficiaries.
